name: Reverse Only Letters
title: Reverse Only Letters
content:
Given a string s, reverse the string according to the following rules:

  • All the characters that are not English letters remain in the same position.
  • All the English letters (lowercase or uppercase) should be reversed.

Return s after reversing it.

 

Example 1:

Input: s = "ab-cd"
Output: "dc-ba"

Example 2:

Input: s = "a-bC-dEf-ghIj"
Output: "j-Ih-gfE-dCba"

Example 3:

Input: s = "Test1ng-Leet=code-Q!"
Output: "Qedo1ct-eeLg=ntse-T!"

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= s.length <= 100
  • s consists of characters with ASCII values in the range [33, 122].
  • s does not contain '\"' or '\\'.

discussion_posts.name: YusenPeng
discussion_posts.content: Hint: Why not try stack? Last-in, first-out:)

discussion_posts.name: akshatv1420
discussion_posts.content: If you know how to use two pointer then this is an easy problem

discussion_posts.name: Satansoft
discussion_posts.content: 1. Two pointers is simplest way to solve;\n2. Maybe working with an array is more comfortable and faster in a language you\'re using than with a string;\n3. RegExp example for cheking that character is letter, it might me helpful for someone: `/[a-zA-Z]/`

discussion_posts.name: ephrem-ketachew
discussion_posts.content: similar to 345. Reverse Vowels of a String\nin my case i only modified 2 lines of if statements

discussion_posts.name: overflowstackdeveloper
discussion_posts.content:
Traverse the string from the front till it pointe to an alphabet and traverse from back till it is also pointing to an alphabet.

If they are pointing character between [33, 122] reverse them.

Hint: Two pointer problem

Similar problem: Check valid palindrome.
